alert.note: Alert for San Miguel; Santa Fe; Torrance (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 5:10PM MDT until August 05 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, north central, and northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Torrance. In east central New Mexico, Guadalupe. In north central New Mexico, Santa Fe. In northeast New Mexico, San Miguel. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 508 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms along and north of Interstate 40 between Wagon Wheel, Clines Corners, and State Road 3. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clines Corners. - This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 240 and 265. Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 201 and 239. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
